meanings.definition: A person who raises irritating and trivial objections.
meanings.sent1: The cavillers in the meeting always find something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: Ignore the cavillers and focus on the main points of the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The cavillers at the party kept pointing out tiny flaws in the decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother is a caviller, always nitpicking everything she does.
meanings.sent5: The cavillers in the group slowed down the decision-making process with their constant objections.

meanings.definition: To raise irritating and trivial objections.
meanings.sent1: She tends to cavill about the smallest details, making it hard to get things done.
meanings.sent2: Please don't cavill over every little mistake; we need to move forward.
meanings.sent3: He would cavill about the color of the pen he was given, even though it wrote perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The child continued to cavill about having to eat his vegetables before dessert.
meanings.sent5: The customer began to cavill about the price, even though it was clearly marked.
